content.description: Climb the somewhat-chossy lower face with gear placements (small cams) to an overhung 4-bolt face above.
content.location: 75 yards to the left of Negro Modelo.

content.description: Probably the best route at the crag (not a huge accomplishment). Climb a clean face with long reaches on good rock.
content.protection: 5 bolts. You will probably want a small cam or two to protect the lower moves.
content.location: First route on the righthand Lounge buttress.

content.description: Climb the loose face on the left side of the crag past 4 bolts and an optional small cam placement.
content.protection: Small TCU/cam is recommended, it's not a pure sport climb.
content.location: 40 yards to the left of Orangaboom. Leftmost route at the crag.

content.description: A chossy start leads to fun perfect hands through a bulge.Â  No anchor.
content.protection: Nuts and cams, from finger size through wide hands.
content.location: 2nd crack to the right of Bud/Bud Lite

content.description: Face/arete right of Negra Modelo. Bud officially climbs the arete, Bud Lite is the face to the right, but they're pretty much the same route.
content.protection: 4 bolts, take some small cams for the runout after the first bolt.

content.description:
The Lounge is a 50 foot south-facing basalt cliff with a few loose sport climbs and some even chossier cracks. Almost never visited, and hence a great place for solitude, but only entertaining for an hour or two, at most. 

  The cliff was developed by Rick Smith and Lee Sheftel in the late 1980s.
